messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where º  Uº R???
messages.msgSnippet: his train is uhhhhh the *choo-choo* kind of train ... haha, amusing only to myself ... dh doesn t like running Amtrac, don t ask me why, prob b/c trains are
messages.messageBody:
"his train" is uhhhhh the *choo-choo* kind of train ... haha, amusing only
to myself ... dh doesn't like running Amtrac, don't ask me why, prob b/c
trains are always LATE and he doesn't like complaints from people ... his
territory is from Taylor/Hearne, TX (above Austin) and down to Laredo but he
usually only goes north from SA to Taylor/Hearne and his trains are freight
trains; gravel, cars, tank trucks, etc... AND YES, the tracks are *usually*
is need of repair ... he retires in 8 yrs, so maybe we'll move to CA after
he retires, oops, nope, don't want to be that far from that grandbaby, don't
you know :} lol ...

Pris ~> who'z such a *dreamer* ...
WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my cats
have learned how to type ...


----- Original Message -----
From: "Lynda" <lurine@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 10:56 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where º Uº R???


>
> "his train" what kinda train??? We don't have Amtrac through here because
> they are warring with the feds and state about fixing the tracks. They do
> have the Amtrac bus route right through town, does he want to drive a bus
> <g>
>
> Lynda, who always likes to be helpful <g>
>
> ----------
> > From: Pris <x_t_sipr@...>
> > To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where º Uº R???
> > Date: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 8:34 AM
> >
> >
> > ahhhhhhhhh mannnnnnnnnnn, THAT'S IT!!! we're packing our bags and
> MOVING
> > IN W/ ºÜº ... you'll have us, won't you??? lol ... oops, first I'd
> better
> > get that FOR SALE sign up in front of the house and clue dh in on this,
> too
> > ... *** nahhhhhhhhh *** his train doesn't go *that* far west <G> ...
> >
> > Pris
> > WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my
> cats
> > have learned how to type ...
> >
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: "Lynda" <lurine@...>
> > To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
> > Sent: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 10:38 AM
> > Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where ºUº R???
> > >
> > > Well, not to make it too terrible for ya, Pris, but we live in an area
> > that
> > > has the average temp for the whole U.S. which means it runs about 67
> > > degrees all year. We only vary by about 10 degrees in either
direction
> > and
> > > only have about a dozen frost days a year. The little town "next
door"
> > has
> > > the most growing days in a year for the whole country.
> > >
> > > However, we can usually drive down the road a bit (half hour to an
> hour)
> > > and be in some friendly (80 to 90's) heat in one direction and serious
> > heat
> > > (90's and up) in the other. But, this year we didn't get the
> "friendly"
> > > heat to often on the river which was a disappointment to the kidlets.
> > >
> > > And going up the hill to the hotter temps was kinda limited as last
> year
> > we
> > > lost 100,000 acres to a fire compliments of the parks boozos and one
of
> > > their controlled burns.
> > >
> > > Lynda
> >
> >
